added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # This is a placeholder for Kilo backports. # Do not use this number for new Liberty work. New work starts after # all the placeholders. # # See this for more information: # http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-March/006827.html from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from sqlalchemy import MetaData, Table from cinder.i18n import _LE, _LI from oslo_utils import timeutils # Get default value via config. The defaults will either # come from the default value set in the quota option # configuration or via cinder.conf if the user has configured # default value for per volume quota there. CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.import_opt('per_volume_quota', 'cinder.quota') LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CLASS_NAME = 'default' CREATED_AT = timeutils.utcnow() def upgrade(migrate_engine): """Add default per volume quota row data into DB.""" meta = MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine quota_classes = Table('quota_classes', meta, autoload=True) row = quota_classes.count().\ where(quota_classes.c.resource == 'per_volume_gigabytes').\ execute().scalar() # Do not add entry if there is already 'default' entry. We don't # want to write over something the user added. if row: LOG.info(_LI("Found existing 'default' entry for " "per_volume_gigabytes in the quota_classes " "table. Skipping insertion of default value.")) return try: # Set default quota for per volume size qci = quota_classes.insert() qci.execute({'created_at': CREATED_AT, 'class_name': CLASS_NAME, 'resource': 'per_volume_gigabytes', 'hard_limit': 1000, 'deleted': False, }) LOG.info(_LI("Added default quota class data into the DB.")) except Exception: LOG.error(_LE("Default quota class data not inserted into the DB.")) raise def downgrade(migrate_engine): """Don't delete the 'default' entries at downgrade time. We don't know if the user had default entries when we started. If they did, we wouldn't want to remove them. So, the safest thing to do is just leave the 'default' entries at downgrade time. """ pass

commit_message:
Add path_args when invoking Resource.list() from proxy layer

Currently, path_args parameter is not given when invoking list
method of resource module from proxy layer. However, without this
arguments, url can't be generated correctly if path_args is defined
in resource's base_url. This patch tried to fix this issue.

Change-Id: Id381867a83362f4e2a5e44004023a4d749398476

commit_message:
Continue to check if nova task is in progress

Continue to check whether the nova server is deleted
completed if nova task is in progress. There is an attribute
'OS-EXT-STS: task_state' which showing task state in nova.

Closes-Bug: #1463716
(cherry picked from commit ab350ce095927037a1d0a8a552fa2b2dfac67d0a)

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/clients/os/nova.py

Change-Id: I64e5319bceeeaead064a7ee062906d707d0a333a

added_lines: def test_server_delete_error_task_in_progress(self): # test server in 'ERROR', but task state in nova is 'deleting' return_server = self.fc.servers.list()[1] server = self._create_test_server(return_server, 'create_delete') server.resource_id = '1234' server_get = self.fc.client.get_servers_1234() self.m.StubOutWithMock(self.fc.client, 'get_servers_1234') def make_error(): server_get[1]["server"]['status'] = "ERROR" server_get[1]["server"]['OS-EXT-STS:task_state'] = 'deleting' def make_error_done(): server_get[1]["server"]['status'] = "ERROR" server_get[1]["server"]['OS-EXT-STS:task_state'] = None get = self.fc.client.get_servers_1234 get().WithSideEffects(make_error).AndReturn(server_get) get().WithSideEffects(make_error_done).AndReturn(server_get) mox.Replay(get) resf = self.assertRaises(exception.ResourceFailure, scheduler.TaskRunner(server.delete)) self.assertIn("Server sample-server delete failed", six.text_type(resf)) self.m.VerifyAll()

commit_message:
Add support for configuration file

This corresponds to the new following option

  --config file_name

Multiple actions can be specified in the configuration file
and will be executed in a single freezer run.

Change-Id: I5b949420df59b6f15ed43007927535435c4615ef
Implements: blueprint config-file
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/75/161175/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Freezer builds a list of jobs, one for each [job:job_name] section # # each job specifies an action which can be the usual: # 'backup', 'restore', 'info', 'admin' # # NOTE: there's little use for info jobs, actually. Or maybe it could # be used to gather information to be pushed to the API # # # Variables defined in [DEFAULT] section are "inherited" # by all job sections. # Each job section can overwrite any variable locally # # Swift OS_ variables # Freezer looks for each OS_* variable in three places: # - environment variables OS_* # - [DEFAULT] section (overwrite environment ones) # - specific job section (overwrite [DEFAUL] and env ones) [DEFAULT] OS_AUTH_URL = https://region-b.geo-1.identity.hpcloudsvc.com:35357/v2.0/ OS_TENANT_NAME = project1234 OS_USERNAME = tyler OS_PASSWORD = quiet OS_REGION_NAME = region-b.geo-1 OS_TENANT_ID = 1234123412341234 encrypt_pass_file = private_key_file log_file = /var/log/freezer.log hostname = myworkstation max_cpu_priority = false insecure = true # this *has* to be global: either we use api for everything, or we don't # default should be true # api endpoint could be specified, or asked to keystone # if api is used then things could go different: api could for example # instruct freezer client to download a new config file. use_api = false [job:mybackup] action = backup hostname = myworkstation mode = fs src_file = /home/tylerdurden/project_mayhem backup_name = project_mayhem_backup container = my_backup_container [job:backup_important_data] action = backup mode = fs description = optional, but can be useful src_file = /home/tylerdurden/project_mayhem backup_name = project_mayhem_backup container = my_backup_container max_backup_level = 7 always_backup_level = 5 restart_always_backup = 5 no_incremental = true lvm_auto_snap = blabla lvm_srcvol = blabla lvm_snapname = blabla lvm_snapsize = 5G lvm_dirmount = blabla lvm_volgroup = blabla max_seg_size = 67108864 exclude = *.log [job:backup_sql_server] action = backup mode = sqlserver sql_server_host = <db-host> sql_server_port = <dp-port> sql_server_user = <db-user> sql_server_password = <db-password> sql_server_database = <db-name> [job:backup_windows_volume] action = backup mode = fs volume = D:\ [job:restore_my_folder] action = restore restore_abs_path = /home/tylerdurden/project_mayhem restore_from_host = myworkstation restore_from_date = 1974-03-25T23:23:23 [job:remove_3days_old_backups] action = admin remove_older_than = 3 backup_name = project_mayhem_backup container = my_backup_container [job:remove_outdated_backups] action = admin remove_from_date = 1974-03-25T23:23:23 backup_name = project_mayhem_backup container = my_backup_container

commit_message:
Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

Any references to future versions are updated to match the new
semver style versions.

Change-Id: I6a35fa0dda798fad93b804d00a46af80f08d475c

commit_message:
Add api support for jobs

removes distinction between actions and configs in the api

The v1/jobs endpoint is the single point of access to the api
to store, search and retrieve operating instruction about
a single freezer run.

optional scheduling informations can be added to a job to
allow for future/recurrent job execution.

removes api endpoints
  - v1/actions
  - v1/configs

adds api endpoints:
  - v1/jobs

Implements blueprint: freezer-api-jobs

Change-Id: Ideeef14dfccd21ddd10b4faa438124c04d2e1ff8

self.assertEqual(retval, 'qwerqwer') @patch('freezer.apiclient.actions.requests') def test_create_fail_when_api_return_error_code(self, mock_requests): self.mock_response.status_code = 500 mock_requests.post.return_value = self.mock_response self.assertRaises(exceptions.MetadataCreationFailure, self.action_manager.create, {'action': 'metadata'}) @patch('freezer.apiclient.actions.requests') def test_delete_ok(self, mock_requests): self.mock_response.status_code = 204 mock_requests.delete.return_value = self.mock_response retval = commit_message:
Implementing 'continue-on' retry policy property

Implements blueprint mistral-retry-continue-on

Change-Id: Idf893fdb201a05521ab2503ad756bafda95ae7d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/85/188385/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from mistral import expressionsfrom mistral.workflow import data_flow retry.get_break_on(), retry.get_continue_on() def __init__(self, count, delay, break_on, continue_on): self._continue_on = continue_on @staticmethod def _get_last_execution(task_ex): action_execs = task_ex.executions action_execs.sort( key=lambda x: x.created_at ) return action_execs[-1] if continue_on is not specified, no need to move to next iteration; if current:count achieve retry:count then policy breaks the loop (regardless on continue-on condition); otherwise - check continue_on condition and if it is True - schedule the next iteration, otherwise policy breaks the loop. last_execution = self._get_last_execution(task_ex) continue_on = expressions.evaluate( self._continue_on, data_flow.evaluate_task_outbound_context(task_ex)) if not states.is_completed(state): continue_triggered = self._continue_on and not continue_on break_triggered = task_ex.state == states.ERROR and self.break_on if not retries_remain or break_triggered or continue_triggered: last_execution.accepted = False
deleted_lines: retry.get_break_on() def __init__(self, count, delay, break_on): No need to move to next iteration. if state != states.ERROR: wf_trace.info( task_ex, "Task '%s' [%s -> ERROR]" % (task_ex.name, task_ex.state) ) if not retries_remain or self.break_on:

commit_message:
Adds FC and ISCSI Cinder drivers for Lenovo Storage Arrays

These drivers depend upon DotHill Cinder drivers.
Using inheritance, we are able to reuse a lot of
DotHill cinder drivers source code.

Change-Id: Ica8631d6954898dbd90a71cc78625bb2aa3b5632
Co-Authored-By: Gauvain Pocentek<gauvain.pocentek@objectif-libre.com>
Implements: blueprint lenovo-fc-iscsi-cinder-driver

commit_message:
devstack: OVN is now in master OVS branch

Per email to the ovs-dev mailing list [1], OVN has been merged
into the master branch of OVS. This patch updates the default
branch used when pulling OVN to reflect the new location.

[1] http://openvswitch.org/pipermail/dev/2015-June/056599.html

Change-Id: I4e3ab54a6264744f6234ee538eb1165099fd9df7
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/75/193675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OVN_BRANCH=${OVN_BRANCH:-origin/master}

commit_message:
Convert RabbitMQ active/active doc to RST

I did not convert the active/passive doc as I believe that
is being deprecated.

Change-Id: I417fc0d0949905fc656217e621c7064ae70ef551

RST formatting of commands

-Experimenting with the usage of
root prompt and gen'ed output.
-Dollar sign for command prompt
produces correct output.
-Moved last note directive to improve
text size.

Change-Id: Ibb7da68509e59a9b7030f4b215e957f70d33f91c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-02 16:33:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/a748eb81f223b0bc65d4763d373e38e6fb79e6cf', 'message': 'Create iSCSI lio portals with right IPs and port

Currently lioadm helper creates portals with fixed IP addresses 0.0.0.0
and ::0 and also uses fixed standard port 3260 instead of using store
configuration (iscsi_ip_address, iscsi_secondary_ip_addresses,
iscsi_port) from the configuration as it should.

This could lead to problems if a different port was defined in the
configuration as the target would be available only on 3260 and other
services would look for it at configured port.

With this fix we now create the right portals with the right port.

Since now we pass list of ips and port to helpers cxt helper has also
been updated to use these parameters instead of going directly to the
configuration.

Conflicts:
	cinder/cmd/rtstool.py

commit_message:
Create iSCSI lio portals with right IPs and port

Currently lioadm helper creates portals with fixed IP addresses 0.0.0.0
and ::0 and also uses fixed standard port 3260 instead of using store
configuration (iscsi_ip_address, iscsi_secondary_ip_addresses,
iscsi_port) from the configuration as it should.

This could lead to problems if a different port was defined in the
configuration as the target would be available only on 3260 and other
services would look for it at configured port.

With this fix we now create the right portals with the right port.

Since now we pass list of ips and port to helpers cxt helper has also
been updated to use these parameters instead of going directly to the
configuration.

Change-Id: I77e8865b1f015a9fa155f2b4552a5d9c27f5e122
Closes-Bug: #1425875
(cherry picked from commit 3abc1d2f63730638abc0344989ccb277b8212642)
Conflicts:
	cinder/cmd/rtstool.py
	cinder/tests/targets/test_cxt_driver.py
	cinder/tests/targets/test_iet_driver.py
	cinder/tests/targets/test_lio_driver.py
	cinder/tests/unit/targets/targets_fixture.py

commit_message:
Deprecate unused exceptions

Deprecate the following unused exceptions:
* VMwareDriverConfigurationException
* UseLinkedCloneConfigurationFault
* MissingParameter

The above exceptions are specific to VMware Nova driver and
should be moved to Nova code base.

Change-Id: I74482d6ac436fbea4383a197f24704bc3d033076
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/49/192149/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_vmware._i18n import _, _LE, _LWdef _print_deprecation_warning(clazz): LOG.warn(_LW("Exception %s is deprecated, it will be removed in the " "next release."), clazz.__name__) def __init__(self, message=None, details=None, **kwargs): super(VMwareDriverConfigurationException, self).__init__( message, details, **kwargs) _print_deprecation_warning(self.__class__) def __init__(self, message=None, details=None, **kwargs): super(MissingParameter, self).__init__(message, details, **kwargs) _print_deprecation_warning(self.__class__)

commit_message:
Raise VimFaultException for unknown faults

Currently VMwareDriverException is raised for unknown
VIM faults. Sometimes clients may need to handle such
faults. Therefore it is better if we throw
VimFaultException with the fault_list set to the relevant
VIM fault class name.

Change-Id: I97d93ceaa82514d029fff87f1c5ad942895d8940
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/39/192139/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if clazz: raise clazz(six.text_type(excep), details=excep.details) fault_class = exceptions.get_fault_class(name) if fault_class: task_ex = fault_class(error_msg) else: task_ex = exceptions.VimFaultException([name], error_msg)

subject: Decompose DVR CSNAT L3 Agent from Compute Node L3 Agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-25 12:41:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/eac9d1930406c33c55f324e0d4d2fffd9c0e1655', 'message': 'Decomposite DVR CSNAT L3 Agent from Compute Node L3 Agent

Currently the same dvr router class is used both by the L3 Agent
in the compute nodes that is responsible for the virtual routers
namespace and the fip namespace and also used by the centralized
SNAT L3 Agent in the network node.
This is the first step to decomposite the two into different
classes.

Next steps:
1) Remove is_snat_host validations and change dvr_router file name
2) Align unit/functional tests
3) Create the correct class in the L3 agent depending on the host
   address
4) Consider non inheritance model

Change-Id: I581a097b9e7c49f20d0eb0e4ca66a25e90d9511b
Partial-Bug: #1458541

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-26 04:56:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a69ab78d6e77904438565a0f44aa2ed5842832ae', 'message': 'Decomposite DVR CSNAT L3 Agent from Compute Node L3 Agent

Currently the same dvr router class is used both by the L3 Agent
in the compute nodes that is responsible for the virtual routers
namespace and the fip namespace and also used by the centralized
SNAT L3 Agent in the network node.
This is the first step for decomposition the two into different
classes.

The above means that we have one class of DVR router which is used
for two jobs (the virtual router namespace wiring and the fips wiring
in the compute node in one hand and the centralized snat wiring in the
other)
The end goal of this patch is to separate the two into different classes
which will also help maintaining it and also help projects that want
to use one but not the other (for example only use the centralized
SNAT behaviour with there own DVR implementation)

Next steps:
1) Remove is_snat_host validations and change dvr_router file name
2) Align unit/functional tests
3) Create the correct class in the L3 agent depending on the host
   address
4) Align with HA+DVR patch
5) Consider non inheritance model

Partial-Bug: #1458541

'}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2015-06-07 09:59:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8983f3acd8c44d14424a0df87995b2037242a015', 'message': 'Decompose DVR CSNAT L3 Agent from Compute Node L3 Agent

Currently the same dvr router class is used both by the L3 Agent
in the compute nodes that is responsible for the virtual routers
namespace and the fip namespace and also used by the centralized
SNAT L3 Agent in the network node.
This is the first step to decompose the two into different
classes.

The above means that we have one class of DVR router which is used
for two jobs (the virtual router namespace wiring and the fips wiring
in the compute node in one hand and the centralized snat wiring in the other)
The end goal of this patch is to separate the two into different classes
which will also help maintaining it and also help projects that want
to use one but not the other (for example only use the centralized
SNAT behaviour with there own DVR implementation)

Next steps:
1) Remove is_snat_host validations and change dvr_router file name
2) Align unit/functional tests
3) Create the correct class in the L3 agent depending on the host
   address
4) Align with HA+DVR patch
5) Consider non inheritance model

Change-Id: I581a097b9e7c49f20d0eb0e4ca66a25e90d9511b
Partial-Bug: #1458541
Partially-Implements: blueprint dvr-router-code-decompose

'}, {'number': 16, 'created': '2015-06-15 17:48:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fd0d8d047a2d8f7c21fad8e9d71481bb796bbcc7', 'message': 'Decompose DVR CSNAT L3 Agent from Compute Node L3 Agent

Currently the same dvr router class is used both by the L3 Agent
in the compute nodes that is responsible for the virtual routers
namespace and the fip namespace and also used by the centralized
SNAT L3 Agent in the network node.
This is the first step to decompose the two into different
classes.

The above means that we have one class of DVR router which is used
for two jobs (the virtual router namespace wiring and the fips wiring
in the compute node in one hand and the centralized snat wiring in the other)
The end goal of this patch is to separate the two into different classes
which will also help maintaining it and also help projects that want
to use one but not the other (for example only use the centralized
SNAT behaviour with there own DVR implementation)

Next step:
This patch extract the logic of SNAT namespace to one class
and the rest (virtual router namespace, SNAT ports, FIPs)
to another class.
This is logically correct and makes the development less
crowded with clear seperation.
The next part will be to create the correct class on the
L3 agent depending on the location of the agent, the end
goal is to have the edge router only created on the network
node.
After this step is accomplished, all the _is_snat_host
checks could be removed and the code will be cleaner.

Change-Id: I581a097b9e7c49f20d0eb0e4ca66a25e90d9511b
Partial-Bug: #1458541
Partially-Implements: blueprint dvr-router-code-decompose

commit_message:
Decompose DVR CSNAT L3 Agent from Compute Node L3 Agent

Currently the same dvr router class is used both by the L3 Agent
in the compute nodes that is responsible for the virtual routers
namespace and the fip namespace and also used by the centralized
SNAT L3 Agent in the network node.
This is the first step to decompose the two into different
classes.

The above means that we have one class of DVR router which is used
for two jobs (the virtual router namespace wiring and the fips wiring
in the compute node in one hand and the centralized snat wiring in the other)
The end goal of this patch is to separate the two into different classes
which will also help maintaining it and also help projects that want
to use one but not the other (for example only use the centralized
SNAT behaviour with there own DVR implementation)

commit_message:
Fix 'unsupported locale setting' errors in init-runonce

Keystone requires a valid LC_ALL environment variable to be set, if left
empty the following output is shown:

"""
$ tools/init-runonce
Downloading glance image.
Creating glance image.
[=============================>] 100%
<snip>
Configuring neutron.
unsupported locale setting
unsupported locale setting
unsupported locale setting
unsupported locale setting
unsupported locale setting
unsupported locale setting
unsupported locale setting
unsupported locale setting
unsupported locale setting
unsupported locale setting
unsupported locale setting
Could not find any suitable endpoint. Correct region?
<snip>
"""

A similar problem occurred in devstack
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1249131), apply the same patch
they use to to sanitize language settings
(https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/stack.sh#L27).

Closes-Bug: #1466548

Change-Id: I8e86a4466181d6dd1c1749915c1c43521af805b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/32/188432/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Sanitize language settings to avoid commands bailing out # with "unsupported locale setting" errors. unset LANG unset LANGUAGE LC_ALL=C export LC_ALL

commit_message:
libvirt: safe_decode xml for i18n logging

The xml argument passed to _create_domain can be a utf-8 encoded string
which causes a UnicodeDecodeError when it is substituted into the _LE
unicode translated message. Safely decoding the xml argument before
attempting to substitute it into the error message avoids the
UnicodeDecodeError.

(cherry picked from commit 96a2283c1a07f0298c57f57d8c4112c1c33b6128)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Change to strutils (instead of encodeutils) and test is located in
"tests/" instead of "tests/unit/".

Closes-Bug: #1453274
Change-Id: I4cf1836f4ca9097f7c6d98c5212a14d24111fe67
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/182536/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def fake_safe_decode(text, *args, **kwargs): return text + 'safe decoded' self.assertIn('safe decoded', msg % args) self.stubs.Set(strutils, 'safe_decode', fake_safe_decode)

commit_message:
Add 3 tests with vcenter and nodes with multiroles:

- vcenter_nodes_with_multiroles_cindervmdk_and_cinder
	Scenario:
            1. Create cluster with vCenter support
            2. Add 6 nodes with following roles:
                controller + Cinder
                controller + CinderVMDK
                controller + Cinder + CinderVMDK
                compute + Cinder
                compute + CinderVMDK
                compute + Cinder + CinderVMDK
            3. Set Nova-Network VlanManager as a network backend
            4. Deploy the cluster
            5. Run network verification
            6. Run OSTF

- vcenter_ceph_nodes_with_multiroles_cindervmdk_and cephosd
	Scenario:
            1. Create cluster with vCenter support
            2. Add 6 nodes with following roles:
                controller + CephOSD
                controller + CinderVMDK
                controller + CephOSD + CinderVMDK
                compute + CephOSD
                compute + CinderVMDK
                compute + CephOSD + CinderVMDK
            3. Set Nova-Network VlanManager as a network backend
            4. Deploy the cluster
            5. Run network verification
            6. Run OSTF

- vcenter_ceilometer_nodes_with_multiroles_cindervmdk_and_mongodb
	Scenario:
            1. Create cluster with vCenter support
            2. Add 3 nodes with following roles:
                controller + MongoDB + Cinder
                controller + MongoDB + CinderVMDK
                controller + MongoDB + Cinder + CinderVMDK
            3. Set Nova-Network VlanManager as a network backend
            4. Deploy the cluster
            5. Run network verification
            6. Run OSTF
- change platform_test to tests_platform in 'vcenter_ceilometer'
Change-Id: I2255344f5b67d598cd1a0a126b0fee6edce20012
Closes-bug: #1453082, #1466861
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/24/183024/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_9], groups=["multiroles", "vcenter_nodes_with_multiroles"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def vcenter_nodes_with_multiroles(self): """Deploy enviroment of vcenter+qemu with nova vlan and nodes with multiroles Scenario: 1. Create cluster with vCenter support 2. Add 6 nodes with following roles: controller + Cinder controller + CinderVMDK controller + Cinder + CinderVMDK compute + Cinder compute + CinderVMDK compute + Cinder + CinderVMDK 3. Set Nova-Network VlanManager as a network backend 4. Deploy the cluster 5. Run network verification 6. Run OSTF Duration: 2.5h """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_9_slaves") # Configure cluster cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings={'volumes_ceph': False, 'volumes_lvm': True}, vcenter_value={ "availability_zones": [ {"vcenter_username": VCENTER_USERNAME, "nova_computes": [ {"datastore_regex": ".*", "vsphere_cluster": "Cluster1", "service_name": "vmcluster1"}, {"datastore_regex": ".*", "vsphere_cluster": "Cluster2", "service_name": "vmcluster2"}, ], "vcenter_host": VCENTER_IP, "az_name": "vcenter", "vcenter_password": VCENTER_PASSWORD, }], "network": {"esxi_vlan_interface": "vmnic1"}}, ) logger.info("cluster is {}".format(cluster_id)) # Assign role to nodes self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, {'slave-01': ['controller', 'cinder'], 'slave-02': ['controller', 'cinder-vmware'], 'slave-03': ['controller', 'cinder', 'cinder-vmware'], 'slave-04': ['compute', 'cinder'], 'slave-05': ['compute', 'cinder-vmware'], 'slave-06': ['compute', 'cinder', 'cinder-vmware'], }) # Configure network interfaces. # Public and Fixed networks are on the same interface # because Nova will use the same vSwitch for PortGroups creating # as a ESXi management interface is located in. interfaces = { 'eth0': ["fuelweb_admin"], 'eth1': ["public", "fixed"], 'eth2': ["management", ], 'eth3': [], 'eth4': ["storage"], } slave_nodes = self.fuel_web.client.list_cluster_nodes(cluster_id) for node in slave_nodes: self.fuel_web.update_node_networks(node['id'], interfaces) # Configure Nova-Network VLanManager. self.fuel_web.update_vlan_network_fixed( cluster_id, amount=8, network_size=32) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.run_ostf( cluster_id=cluster_id, test_sets=['smoke', 'sanity', 'ha']) @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_9], groups=["multiroles", "vcenter_glance_ceph_nodes_with_multiroles"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def vcenter_glance_ceph_nodes_with_multiroles(self): """Deploy enviroment of vcenter+qemu with nova vlan and nodes with multiroles Scenario: 1. Create cluster with vCenter support 2. Add 6 nodes with following roles: controller + CephOSD controller + CephOSD + Cinder controller + CephOSD + Cinder + CinderVMDK compute + CephOSD compute + CephOSD + Cinder compute + CephOSD + Cinder + CinderVMDK 3. Set Nova-Network VlanManager as a network backend 4. Deploy the cluster 5. Run network verification 6. Run OSTF Duration: 2.5h """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_9_slaves") # Configure cluster cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings={'volumes_ceph': True, 'volumes_lvm': False}, vcenter_value={ "availability_zones": [ {"vcenter_username": VCENTER_USERNAME, "nova_computes": [ {"datastore_regex": ".*", "vsphere_cluster": "Cluster1", "service_name": "vmcluster1"}, {"datastore_regex": ".*", "vsphere_cluster": "Cluster2", "service_name": "vmcluster2"}, ], "vcenter_host": VCENTER_IP, "az_name": "vcenter", "vcenter_password": VCENTER_PASSWORD, }], "network": {"esxi_vlan_interface": "vmnic1"}}, ) logger.info("cluster is {}".format(cluster_id)) # Assign role to nodes self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, {'slave-01': ['controller', 'ceph-osd'], 'slave-02': ['controller', 'ceph-osd', 'cinder'], 'slave-03': ['controller', 'ceph-osd', 'cinder', 'cinder-vmware'], 'slave-04': ['compute', 'ceph-osd'], 'slave-05': ['compute', 'ceph-osd', 'cinder-vmware'], 'slave-06': ['compute', 'ceph-osd', 'cinder', 'cinder-vmware'], }) # Configure network interfaces. # Public and Fixed networks are on the same interface # because Nova will use the same vSwitch for PortGroups creating # as a ESXi management interface is located in. interfaces = { 'eth0': ["fuelweb_admin"], 'eth1': ["public", "fixed"], 'eth2': ["management", ], 'eth3': [], 'eth4': ["storage"], } slave_nodes = self.fuel_web.client.list_cluster_nodes(cluster_id) for node in slave_nodes: self.fuel_web.update_node_networks(node['id'], interfaces) # Configure Nova-Network VLanManager. self.fuel_web.update_vlan_network_fixed( cluster_id, amount=8, network_size=32) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.run_ostf( cluster_id=cluster_id, test_sets=['smoke', 'sanity', 'ha']) @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_9], groups=["multiroles", "vcenter_ceilometer_nodes_with_multiroles"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def vcenter_ceilometer_nodes_with_multiroles(self): """Deploy enviroment of vcenter+qemu with nova vlan and nodes with multiroles Scenario: 1. Create cluster with vCenter support 2. Add 6 nodes with following roles: controller + MongoDB + Cinder controller + MongoDB + CinderVMDK controller + MongoDB + Cinder + CinderVMDK compute + MongoDB + Cinder compute + MongoDB + CinderVMDK compute + MongoDB + Cinder + CinderVMDK 3. Set Nova-Network VlanManager as a network backend 4. Deploy the cluster 5. Run network verification 6. Run OSTF Duration: 2.5h """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_9_slaves") # Configure cluster cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings={'volumes_ceph': False, 'volumes_lvm': True}, vcenter_value={ "availability_zones": [ {"vcenter_username": VCENTER_USERNAME, "nova_computes": [ {"datastore_regex": ".*", "vsphere_cluster": "Cluster1", "service_name": "vmcluster1"}, {"datastore_regex": ".*", "vsphere_cluster": "Cluster2", "service_name": "vmcluster2"}, ], "vcenter_host": VCENTER_IP, "az_name": "vcenter", "vcenter_password": VCENTER_PASSWORD, }], "network": {"esxi_vlan_interface": "vmnic1"}}, ) logger.info("cluster is {}".format(cluster_id)) # Assign role to nodes self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, {'slave-01': ['controller', 'mongo', 'cinder'], 'slave-02': ['controller', 'mongo', 'cinder-vmware'], 'slave-03': ['controller', 'mongo', 'cinder', 'cinder-vmware'], 'slave-04': ['compute', 'mongo', 'cinder'], 'slave-05': ['compute', 'mongo', 'cinder-vmware'], 'slave-06': ['compute', 'mongo', 'cinder', 'cinder-vmware'], }) # Configure network interfaces. # Public and Fixed networks are on the same interface # because Nova will use the same vSwitch for PortGroups creating # as a ESXi management interface is located in. interfaces = { 'eth0': ["fuelweb_admin"], 'eth1': ["public", "fixed"], 'eth2': ["management", ], 'eth3': [], 'eth4': ["storage"], } slave_nodes = self.fuel_web.client.list_cluster_nodes(cluster_id) for node in slave_nodes: self.fuel_web.update_node_networks(node['id'], interfaces) # Configure Nova-Network VLanManager. self.fuel_web.update_vlan_network_fixed( cluster_id, amount=8, network_size=32) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.run_ostf( cluster_id=cluster_id, test_sets=['smoke', 'sanity', 'ha'])

commit_message:
Fix packaging issue by removing ${python:Depends}

Debian `control` file establishes the dependencies of the package. One
function that can be used is the ${python:Depends}, which will create
`python-*` dependencies based on `requirements.txt`. So it was defining
`python-oslo.log` as dependency automatically.

Problem is `python-oslo.log` does not exist as a package in Debian,
correct name is `python-oslo-log`. So better to remove the
${python:Depends} and define all the dependencies explicitly.

Change-Id: Idab8899e5fe47c1c9b7397ede68c2dbb2b7c884d

commit_message:
Validate subnet for pool/vip properly

There was a validation to prevent VIP and Pool that belong in the same
subnet to be created. This was wrong because LB would work even if they
are in the same subnet as long as the client is not in the same subnet
as the VIP.  The validation should have occurred only when there as a
health monitor associated with a pool  This patch implementes the
correct validation.

Change-Id: Ib2dd24048a6badedb8baf7b3625d47f0e87f34b2
Fixes: MNP-154

commit_message:
Port common.crypt to Python 3

* Replace chr(0) with b'\0'
* Use ''.join(chr(x) ...) with b''.join(six.int2byte(x) ...)
* Replace str with six.binary_type
* test_misc: replace '' with b'' in plaintext_list, plaintext must be
  bytes
* tox: add test_misc to Python 3.4

Change-Id: I5f3bed2c664181210b76b1a5b62eacda47420e7f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/05/192905/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

* Fix tox -e py34, but only run glance.tests.unit.test_versions

Later, more tests will be added tox -e py34, and a voting py34 gate will

Depends-on: I7e5a24453cf837391e1fad73b7bb0c0fbd8963e2

commit_message:
Port api.versions to Python 3

With this change, tox -e py34 now pass:

* On Python 3, jsonutils.dumps() returns Unicode on Python 3, whereas
  HTTP body is bytes: encode JSON to UTF-8
* Fix tox -e py34, but only run glance.tests.unit.test_versions

Later, more tests will be added tox -e py34, and a voting py34 gate will
be added to ensure that no Python 3 regression is added back.

Depends-on: I66b7d6053643e82d9c11af568190d82ffe7f385e
Depends-on: I7e5a24453cf837391e1fad73b7bb0c0fbd8963e2
Change-Id: I8a546fcfa3b8132885d2f8f9bbbf999ca0500e31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/04/192904/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:py34] commands = python -m testtools.run \ glance.tests.unit.test_versions

Edit the following configuration files, taking the " "below actions for each file:" msgstr "" "すべての設定ファイルは、<filename>/etc/trove</filename> に置く必要がありま" "す。以下の設定ファイルを編集して、各ファイルに対して以下の操作を実行します。" "Assuming you have created an image for the type of database you want, and " "have updated the datastore to use that image, you can now create a trove " "instance (Database service). To do this, use the trove <placeholder-1/> " "command." msgstr "" "使用したいデータベースの種類に応じたイメージを作成し、そのイメージを使用する" "ためにデータストアを更新したことを仮定すると、trove インスタンス (Database " "service) を作成できます。このために、trove ping the tenant router gateway:" msgstr "" "外部ネットワークのホストからテナントルーターのゲートウェイに ping します。" "If you intend to use non-raw image types such as QCOW2 and VMDK, install the " "QEMU support package:" msgstr "" (nova-network) を用いた最小アーキテクチャー例 － サービ" "ス配置" msgid ""msgid "" "Most cloud images support <glossterm>public key authentication</glossterm> " "rather than conventional user name/password authentication. Before launching " "an instance, you must generate a public/private key pair using " "<placeholder-1/> and add the public key to your OpenStack environment." msgstr "" "多くのクラウドイメージは、慣習的なユーザー名とパスワードによる認証ではなく、" "<glossterm baseform=\"public key authentication\">公開鍵認証</glossterm>をサ" "ポートします。インスタンスの起動前に、<placeholder-1/> を使用して公開鍵と秘密" "鍵のキーペアを生成し、OpenStack linkend=\"debconf-dbconfig-common\">データベース管理</link>、<link " "linkend=\"debconf-keystone_authtoken\">Identity のクレデンシャル</link>、" "<link linkend=\"debconf-api-endpoints\">サービスエンドポイント登録</link>、" "<link credentials to perform the following " "steps as a non-administrative project:" msgstr "" "<literal>demo</literal> クレデンシャルを読み込み、非管理プロジェクトとして以" "下の手順を実行します。" "Start the Image service services and configure them to start when the system " "boots:" msgstr "" "Image service のサービスを起動し、システム起動時に起動するよう設定します。" msgid """The Object Storage service does not use a SQL database on the controller " "node. Instead, it uses distributed SQLite databases on each storage node." msgstr "" "Object Storage サービスは、コントローラーノードの SQL データベースを使用しま" "せん。代わりに、各ストレージノードの分散 SQLite データベースを使用します。" msgid """The Telemetry chapter provides an Image service configuration that enables " "notifications." msgstr "Telemetry の章に通知を有効化する Image service の設定があります。" msgid """This chapter assumes that you already have a working OpenStack environment " "with at least the following components installed: Compute, Image service, " "Identity." msgstr "" "本章は、すでに OpenStack 環境が動作していること、少なくとも Compute、Image " "service、Identity がインストールされていることを仮定しています。" msgid ""msgid "This procedure installs the Database service on the controller node." msgstr "" "この手順は、コントローラーノードに Database サービスをインストールします。" msgid "To install the Database service on the controller:" msgstr "Database サービスをコントローラーにインストールする方法:" "To verify that the Database service is installed and configured correctly, " "try executing a trove command:" msgstr "" "Database サービスがインストールされ、正しく設定されていることを検証するため" "に、trove コマンドを実行してみます。" msgid """Your first instance uses the <literal>cirros-0.3.4-x86_64</literal> image." msgstr "" "最初のインスタンスは <literal>cirros-0.3.4-x86_64</literal> イメージを使用し" "ます。" msgid ""

Changed update_local_port_num method to return the Port Data Object, instead of
returning multiple properties

commit_message:
Revert "Remove unneeded package subscription-manager"

It seems that this package somehow brings python-ethtools to container.
So let put it back and find a way to remove it properly without removing
required packages.

Closes-Bug: #1467107

This reverts commit 656f39cca441e1593b7ea536ce7a35e10cf48884.

Change-Id: Iee57811be5434d27ea90342f2aa9439a0518d30c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/10/193810/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: subscription-manager# Disable subscription-manager plugins sed -i 's/^enabled.*/enabled=0/' /etc/yum/pluginconf.d/product-id.conf || : sed -i 's/^enabled.*/enabled=0/' /etc/yum/pluginconf.d/subscription-manager.conf || :

commit_message:
Port remote_fs driver to use new driver model

Port glusterfs and nfs drivers to ABC classes. Abstract
San class must be ported as well, otherwise we will have
a inheritance loop for IBM NAS driver.

Change-Id: I905c0256402472de87c7fccb922c207ce5a0e483
Implements: blueprint abc-driver-update

commit_message:
Fix wrong check when use image in local

When use bdm to boot with image in local,we should check
whether boot_index is valid firstly.

For example,when use novaclient,boot_index is a string ,
it can't compare with integer directly.

Change-Id: I8c0c3793e4453b9a5d6daac7404c281c163ac474
Closes-bug:#1459917
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/76/186976/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: boot_index = int(api_dict.get('boot_index', -1)) except ValueError: raise exception.InvalidBDMFormat( details=_("Boot index is invalid."))

commit_message:
Use a class constant for the default path based backend path

When no path is provided to a path based backend via configuration
use a class constant to provide the default, and override this in
backends that support providing defaults.

Change-Id: I0a6c88398403a162b113e34abe7e56821d1f02bc

added_lines: #: Default path used when none is provided. DEFAULT_PATH = None self.path = self._conf.get('path') if not self.path: self.path = self.DEFAULT_PATH

commit_message:
Add `simple_linear_listening` example to generated docs

This one is a nice to have in the examples, and should
also be updated to not use deprecated properties.

Change-Id: I5ee754525caccf0a9ea2a2b00aaa4e0d305e55b7
